23-0837.summary: Recommendation to approve the minutes for the Federal Legislation Committee meeting held Wednesday, November 16, 2022.A motion was made by Member Kerr, seconded by Vice Chair Allen, to approve recommendation.  The motion carried by the following vote:Yes: 3 - Kerr, Allen and Uranga2.

23-0839.summary: Recommendation to receive and file a presentation on the Taxpayer Protection and Government Accountability Act and recommend an oppose position to the City Council for consideration.Tyler Curley, Acting Deputy City Manager, spoke.Chair Uranga spoke.Tyler Curley, Acting Deputy City Manager, spoke.A motion was made by Vice Chair Allen, seconded by Member Kerr, to approve recommendation.  The motion carried by the following vote:Yes: 3 - Kerr, Allen and Uranga4.

23-0840.summary: Recommendation to receive and file a presentation on Senate Bill 525 (Durazo) and recommend a support position to the City Council for consideration.Tyler Curley, Acting Deputy City Manager, spoke.Vice Chair Allen spoke.Councilwoman Kerr spoke.Chair Uranga spoke.Tyler Curley, Acting Deputy City Manager, spoke.Vice Chair Allen spoke.Councilwoman Kerr spoke.Page 2 of 4411 W. OCEAN BOULEVARDCIVIC CHAMBERS, 12:30 PMTUESDAY, AUGUST 1, 2023CITY OF LONG BEACHINTERGOVERNMENTAL AFFAIRS COMMITTEE MINUTESChair Uranga spoke.A motion was made by Vice Chair Allen, seconded by Member Kerr, to approve recommendation, as amended, to receive and file a presentation on Senate Bill 525 (Durazo), and take a Watch position.  The motion carried by the following vote:Yes: 3 - Kerr, Allen and Uranga5.

23-0841.summary: Recommendation to receive and file a presentation on the State’s Fiscal Year 2023-2024 Budget.Nicholas Cabeza, Government Affairs Analyst, City Manager Department, spoke; and provided a PowerPoint presentation.Councilwoman Kerr spoke.Tyler Curley, Acting Deputy City Manager, spoke.Vice Chair Allen spoke.Tyler Curley, Acting Deputy City Manager, spoke.A dialogue ensued between Vice Chair Allen and Tyler Curley, Acting Deputy City Manager.A motion was made by Member Kerr, seconded by Vice Chair Allen, to approve recommendation.  The motion carried by the following vote:Yes: 3 - Kerr, Allen and Uranga6.
